data.name: Comprehensive price formatting
data.description:
# Storyline
![Xsoslla](https://i.imgur.com/xX3TBo6.png)
You are developer at **Xsoslla** and currently you're working on price formatting system. You have a lot of prices to display here. So for your teammates' convenient and yours, you've decided make function that will easily covert given number to a price.

# Task
You're given digits, **sometimes** language tag (default: en) and currency code (default: usd).
This means you will need to apply right formatting on it and add currency sign depending on given data. A number should have two digits after comma.

#### You found some useful links:
---
[Learn about language tags](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_639-1)

[Learn about currency codes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217)

---
# Examples
```python
1.toPrice() => "$1.00"
1.toPrice("ru") => "1,00 $"
1.toPrice("ru", "rub") => "1,00 â‚½"
1.toPrice("77", "rub") => "Invalid language tag"
1.toPrice("ru", "rub-") => "Invalid currency code"
```
